page.title: 12Old Homes in Well
page.content: Well (Saxon Welle) had a spring emerging from the limestone rocks near Masham Lane.Early Christians dedicated the well to St.Michael.Water now flows into a culvert coming out beyond the mere as a stream through the village {St. Michael's Cottages, Well} In 1342 Ralph Neville founded and endowed a hospital dedicated to St. Michael the Archangel.This was rebuilt in 1758 as a row of 8 almshouses, recently modernised to make 4 central heated cottages.They are let at a nominal rent to any suitable elderly person and are run by the trustees of United Charities,Well. The tiny chapel adjoining once used daily by hospital inmates is now used by the Junior Church. {Well Hall}- The outstanding feature is the vaulted room.It became a school for young gentlemen in 17th century.
